doc.title: Mengniu Dairy
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Mengniu Dairy Patience is a virtue reiterate a 3-stage recovery roadmapMengniu Dairy Patience is a virtue reiterate a 3-(2)_2025-08-29

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 23.90 HKD | Price: 15.84 HKD

We cut 2025/26E EPS 15%/5% post Mengniu's widely- expected weak 1H25 (see our first- take report), but maintain PO of HK\$23.9 (see Page 3 for more details). We also maintain our view of a 3- stage recovery roadmap: 1) margin recovery, 2) sales recovery, and 3) raw milk cycle inflection. Weak demand might slow the pace of recovery (esp. Stage 2 & 3, with continued weakness in 2H25), but should not reverse the direction, given positive supply- side changes. We view Mengniu as a high- beta proxy to the future raw milk cyclical inflection - we see downside protection at the currently level (given its almost 4% dividend yield and the support of HK\$15 since 24 Sept 2024, the start of the current bull market), while normalizing earnings in 12- 18 months on raw milk cycles and cost control could also lead to potential re- rating. Reiterate Buy.

1) Updated guide: MSD-HSD full-year sales decline in 2025 (vs. -6.9% YoY in 1H) and core OPM to be similar to 8.2% in 2024 (8.5% in 1H25, vs 7.0%/9.4% in 1H/2H24). Non-core losses will decline significantly YoY in 2H25. 2) Raw milk cycle: The inflection point is unlikely to arrive this year, given continued demand & supply imbalance, but is expected to be seen in 2026 on accelerating capacity cuts. 3) Liquid milk: White liquid milk has been a key drag, partly due to weak traditional channels and challenges from freshly-made drinks. Nevertheless, its decline has narrowed in 2Q and 3QTD, along with a healthy channel inventory. In addition, low-temperature dairy sales declined only LSD and fresh milk grew >20% in 1H. 4) Growing businesses: Mengniu now focuses on 2B and non-liquid milk segments to gradually reduce its exposure to liquid milk and drive growth. 5) Capital deployment: Mengniu targets no more than RMB2.5bn Capex in 2025 and Estimates (Dec) (CNY)2023A2024A2025E2026E2027ENet Income (Adjusted - mn)4,8091054,1965,3906,012EPS1.220.0271.071.371.53EPS Change (YoY)-9.1%-97.8%NM28.5%11.6%Consensus EPS (Visible Alpha)1.251.451.60Dividend / Share0.4870.5070.5330.7530.917Free Cash Flow / Share1.141.290.8901.591.79Valuation (Dec)P/E11.79x559.24x13.67x10.64x9.54xDividend Yield3.38%3.40%3.66%5.17%6.29%EV / EBITDA*10.41x18.38x10.13x9.50x8.93xFree Cash Flow Yield7.85%8.90%6.14%10.95%12.35%

China Mengniu is one of China's top 2 dairies. The company manufactures and distributes dairy products, such as UHT milk, milk beverages, yogurt, and ice cream under the Mengniu brand in China. Liquid milk accounts for close to \(90\%\) of sales, while the rest is milk powder and ice cream.

We rate the stock Buy. Our positive view is based on 1) earnings recovery on easy comps and self- help (such as stringent cost control), 2) likely raw milk cycle trough in 1- 2 years, and 3) improving shareholder returns.
Exhibit 1:Mengniu: Earnings Revision We cut our 2025/26E EPS by \(15\% /5\%\)
Source: BofA Global Research estimates. \\*Core operating profit is defined as GP - SG&A expenses - Educational Surcharges & City Construction Tax & Other Taxes.

We cut our 2025E EPS \(15\%\) to factor in weak topline strength and increased loss from associates, but only lower 2026E EPS \(5\%\) as the recovery is still largely on track in 2026. We maintain our PO of HK\$23.9, derived from a 50/50 blend of P/E and DCF. Our P/E based value is HK\$24.3, based on unchanged 15x P/E after rolling over our valuation anchor from 2025 to 2026, as we view 2026 as a year of normalized earnings. Our DCF based value is HK\$23.4, based on a 10.4% WACC, a 0.9 beta (both unchanged) and 2% terminal growth rate (lowered from 3% given soft demand outlook).
Exhibit 2:Mengniu:1H25 Results Review Revenue was \(-6.9\%\) YoY; core OP was \(+13.4\%\) and NPAT was \(-16.4\%\) YoY in 1H25

Our PO of \(\mathsf{HK}\S 23.9\) is based on a 50/50 blend of P/E and DCF. Our P/E value is \(\mathsf{HK}\S 24.3\) , derived from a 15x 2026E P/E, a \(25\%\) discount to its 10- year average valuation, to reflect slower long- term trend growth. Our DCF value is \(\mathsf{HK}\S 23.4\) , based on a \(10.4\%\) WACC, a 0.9 beta, and \(2\%\) terminal growth rate. We expect solid FCF generation, due to its steady growth outlook with improving margins.

The downside risks to our price objective are (1) a less favorable raw milk price trend, (2) more rational, or intensified competition from peers, and (3) a slower- than- expected sales and margin recovery.
The upside risks to our price objective are (1) a more favorable raw milk price trend, (2) easing competition from peers, and (3) a faster- than- expected sales and margin recovery.
